intro: Aspidopterys dunniana, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a striking evergreen plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feathery fronds. The plant can grow up to 20 meters in height, with a trunk that is often covered in a fibrous, spongy material. Its fronds are bi-directionally pinnate, with a distinctive midrib and a dense arrangement of pinnae. Aspidopterys dunniana thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
